title: Jet Cash
author: Jet Cash
content: I've had another enquiry from a potential domain name buyer this morning. I've decided that I am only going to accept Bitcoin in payment for domain names, and I appreciate that most potential buyers will be cautious or naive about Bitcoin. I own the domain name Bitcoin Uncovered.com, and I always intended to create an information site on the name. Unfortunately, personal circumstance have denied me the time to doi this, but I hope to rectify this later this year. In the mean time I thought that I would refer potential buyers to this forum to gain information. Rather than directing them to the home page, I wondered if it would be better to link to the discussion board, or maybe the beginner's board. I have a slight preference for the beginner's board, do you agree that this would be the best introduction?

comments.author: Cuenta Alternativa
comments.body: Quote from: Jet Cash on April 29, 2023, 07:36:14 AMI have a slight preference for the beginner's board, do you agree that this would be the best introduction?The problem with this section is that it is not exactly where the best quality discussions take place. The B&H is less bad in that sense, I would say. I was also thinking of the technical boards, which are much more serious, but perhaps too technical for someone approaching the subject for the first time. So if I had to choose one, it would be the B&H, or perhaps better the threads explaining what bitcoin is and how to use it.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Since you said potential buyers of the domain name that means you are the seller, I don’t think it’s a bad idea or off topic from the forum since it involves bitcoin domain buying.But what i think is that the beginners and help board is to help out newbies and less experienced members out on issues they can handle or try to solve their problems, so it may not be the appropriate place.On the other hand since it involves buying and selling then the market place board, and it’s child boards like services is an appropriate place for this.For the purpose of the potential buyers to learn about it and get information you can direct them to the service discussion in particular.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=85.0

comments.author: Jet Cash
comments.body: Yes, I deal in domain names, and almost exclusively .com names. The market place is really only of use for selling crypto names imho, and the current enquiry is for a vehicle related name, and nothing to do with Bitcoin or crypto. It is a personal choice  of mine to accept Bitcoin, and only Bitcoin, as a payment medium. I decided to pick up selected domain names as a means to increase my Bitcoin savings. I had another look at the B&H board, and I agree it is a bit of a mess. I don't think questions about merit should be on it for example. Maybe the best option would be to refer the buyer to the forum home page, and suggest he looks at the discussion board first. The main difficulty if he is a naive user will be to convince him that it is worth the effort to buy the Satoshi to send to me. I'll also need to see which exchanges will transfer Bitcoin directly to my address, as that would avoid him having to set up a wallet to make the transfer.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: Quote from: Jet Cash on April 29, 2023, 08:39:06 AMI'll also need to see which exchanges will transfer Bitcoin directly to my address, as that would avoid him having to set up a wallet to make the transfer.All exchanges can be used to transfer Bitcoin to your address, just make sure you add all types of Bitcoin address e.g. legacy (1), segwit (3) and native segwit (bc1q) because I've seen few exchanges still not support native segwit address.If you don't care to teach your buyer to protect his privacy, you can link him to big and popular centralized exchange.If you care to teach your buyer to protect his privacy, you can link this thread List of P2P/no-KYC exchanges  on your site.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Jet Cash on April 29, 2023, 07:36:14 AMI own the domain name Bitcoin Uncovered.com, and I always intended to create an information site on the name. Unfortunately, personal circumstance have denied me the time to doi this, but I hope to rectify this later this year.Just a heads up: you can quickly build a live website in less than an hour with Wordpress + Elementor(optional). assuming you're problem is with the site infra, not the site content. Most web hosting providers has one-click Wordpress installs as well.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: Quote from: Jet Cash on April 29, 2023, 07:36:14 AMIn the mean time I thought that I would refer potential buyers to this forum to gain information. Rather than directing them to the home page, I wondered if it would be better to link to the discussion board, or maybe the beginner's board. I have a slight preference for the beginner's board, do you agree that this would be the best introduction?Well from my little stayed over here, leaving it here in this board would be more better since it involves with bitcoin discussion and payment with bitcoin, moving it to beginner and Help section may not gain much attention or the required audience if there could be much questions coming.Quote from: Jet Cash on April 29, 2023, 08:39:06 AMI'll also need to see which exchanges will transfer Bitcoin directly to my address, as that would avoid him having to set up a wallet to make the transfer.I don't know how expose your client could be but I suggest you should know the country he/she is coming from so that you may ref them the best exchange that is suitable for them to operates on, then after making accounts your clients can then withdraw directly to your payment address without having to withdraw to their wallet before sending to you. Please if using a centralized exchange they should bear in mind of undergoing through KYC if this could be hard for them then you may ref them p2p service operate from this forum, for easier and smooth deal.
